text: The IX South American Games (Spanish: Juegos Sudamericanos; Portuguese: Jogos Sul-Americanos) was a multi-sport event held between 19–30 March 2010 in Medellín, Colombia. The Games were organized by the South American Sports Organization (ODESUR), who awarded the Games to the city with 8 votes over the bid by previous host Santiago, Chile (6 votes)."MEDELLÍN SERÁ LA SEDE DE LOS JUEGOS SUDAMERICANOS 2010," NOTICIAS ODESUR, accessed November 7, 2006 ==Participating nations== * * * * * * (hosts) * * * * * * * * * == Medal count == The medal count for these games is tabulated below. This table is sorted by the number of gold medals earned by each country. The number of silver medals is taken into consideration next, and then the number of bronze medals. == Sports == * 20px Archery (28) * 20px Athletics (44) * 20px Badminton (6) * 20px Baseball (1) * 20px Basketball (2) * 20px Beach volleyball (2) * 20px Bowling (15) * 20px Boxing (14) * 20px Canoeing (24) * 20px Cycling (28) * 20px Diving (9) * 20px Equestrian (7) * 20px Fencing (12) * 20px Football (1) * 20px Futsal (1) * 20px Gymnastics (23) * 20px Handball (2) * 20px Judo (22) * 20px Karate (18) * 20px Roller skating (32) * 20px Rowing (14) * 20px Sailing (6) * 20px Shooting (34) * 20px Softball (1) * 20px Squash (7) * 20px Swimming (44) * 20px Synchronized swimming (3) * 20px Table tennis (7) * 20px Taekwondo (16) * 20px Tennis (5) * 20px Triathlon (8) * 20px Volleyball (2) * 20px Water polo (2) * 20px Waterskiing (10) * 20px Weightlifting (15) * 20px Wrestling (20) == References == == External links == * Official website South American Games South American Games South American Games South American Category:Multi-sport events in Colombia Category:Sport in Medellín Category:South American Games Category:March 2010 sports events in South America
title: 2010 South American Games
